meta.name: description
meta.content: The "WWW-Authenticate" header field indicates authentication scheme(s)

main.p: The "WWW-Authenticate" header field indicates the authentication scheme(s) and parameters applicable to the target resource.
Origin servers MUST send the WWW-Authenticate header with a 401 (Unauthorized) status code.
The variant of this header for intermediate nodes (proxies) is Proxy-Authenticate.
Clients that see this header can test if they understand and have credentials for any of the authorization schemes listed, and if so, re-try the request with them.
main.pre: WWW-Authenticate = 1#challenge challenge = auth-scheme [ 1*SP ( token68 / #auth-param ) ] auth-scheme = token auth-param = token BWS "=" BWS ( token / quoted-string ) token68 = 1*( ALPHA / DIGIT / "-" / "." / "_" / "~" / "+" / "/" ) *"="
main.p: auth-scheme is one of the registered values in the Authentication Scheme Registry.
main.pre: WWW-Authenticate: Newauth realm="apps", type=1, title="Login to \"apps\"", Basic realm="simple"
